wikiData.title: V.L. v. E.L.
wikiData.Prior: Judgment for petitioner, No. CS-13-719 (April 15, 2014 [[Alabama District Court|Ala. Dist. Ct.]], [[Jefferson County, Alabama|Jefferson Cty.]]); rev'd, [https://caselaw.findlaw.com/al-court-of-civil-appeals/1681691.html No. 2130683] ([[Alabama Court of Civil Appeals|Ala. Ct. Civ. App.]] Oct. 24, 2014); on rehearing, aff'd in part, sub nom. ''Ex parte E.L.'', No. 2130683, 2015 [[Westlaw|WL]] 836916 (Ala. Ct. Civ. App. Feb. 27, 2015); rev., No. 1140595, 2015 [[Westlaw|WL]] 5511249 ([[Alabama Supreme Court|Ala.]] September 18, 2015)
wikiData.Procedural: Visitation order issued in Jefferson County Family Court (Apr 2014); reversed by Alabama Court of Civil Appeals (Oct 2014); rehearing granted, Family Court ruling affirmed by Alabama Court of Civil Appeals (Feb 2015); reversed and remanded by Supreme Court of Alabama (Sep 2015). Motion by petitioner to stay the ruling granted by U.S. Supreme Court (Dec 2015). Order reversed by the United States Supreme Court, adoption rights restored to V.L. (March 2016).
wikiData.Holding: Under the Full Faith and Credit Clause, the State of Alabama must recognize the adoption decree granted by a Georgia state court in 2007, regardless of how that court came to its conclusion granting the decree. Supreme Court of Alabama reversed and remanded.
wikiData.LawsApplied: [[Full Faith and Credit Clause|U.S. Const., Art. IV, §1]]; {{nowrap|[[Georgia Code|Ga. Code Ann.]] §19–8–5(a)}}
